channel.title: "Private Archives" - Community Input Needed
channel.description:
[i]Okay so here it is, instead of a "Project Tools Package Version 2" - I've been planning to turn it into a website
http://privatearchives.bounceme.net/pub/home.html http://privatearchives.bounceme.net/pub/home.html http://privatearchives.bounceme.net/pub/home.html http://privatearchives.bounceme.net/pub/home.html http://privatearchives.bounceme.net/pub/home.html
If the website is offline it's because my computer is off (currently hosted from home as still under contruction; check again later)
Hopefully now this will make you all understand a bit more of what I am working towards. I tried to keep it a secret but I couldn't. If I want the feedback I've got to tell everyone.[/i]
[b]Let me know what you think about the concept and I'll answer any questions, or just continue with the suggestions. Thanks.[/b]
Okay, I am working very hard on a verison 2 of my Project Tools Server Package to give the community exactly what they want.
I want to know what you want to see? Basic, moderate or advanced, request it here and I'll see what I can do.
[b]It looks like Hyperion will be popular, as there are 2 or 3 people contributing regarding Hype.[/b]
[ul][li]Shard development tutorials[/li] [li]Hyperion development tutorials[/li] [li]RuneSource development tutorials[/li] [li]JAR files containing item, npc, object, animation, gfx IDs (and anything else that is available), along with a small guide on adding them to a client to load from (just like MoparScape 3.2) for all revisions.[/li] [li]Expansion on RuneScape Music[/li] [li]A History of RuneScape Private Servers[/li] [li]Creating, modifying and maintaining forums for your private server[/li] [li]Writing and understanding PVP and NPC combat[/li] [li]Creating and maintaining a respectful private server development thread[/li] [li]Recommended bases[/li] [li]Information about setting up and using in general, all popular bases (and some of the "diamonds in the roughs").[/li] [li]Anything on frameworks (login protocols, NPC/player rendering/logging in/networking/streaming).[/li] [li]Snippets of information, for example, but not limited to, XP tables, optimizing common methods etc.[/li][/ul]
Request absolutely anything - I want to expand this to be desired by almost everyone. ID lists, source tutorials, framework information, common RSPS error fixes, bug fixes, model information, rare deobs and caches, lost sources, the list goes on. You name it, I'll consider it.
Spread the word, please.

item.title: "Private Archives" - Community Input Needed
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

It’s really not complex, it would require a lot less work on your part, and it would look nicer and be easier to use…

Read full topic

I just want plain old pages with lots and lots of information. Nothing fancy. Nothing complex.

@ranger_squad wrote:

It’s not really about being moderated for breaking rules, I was more thinking of mods being able to verify a snippet as to working or not.

Read full topic

item.title: "Private Archives" - Community Input Needed
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

I don’t want to create a community where people have to be moderated for breaking rules and can post in view of the public, hence why I stated in the prolouge I’m not going to be creating yet another forum.

And you lot got my Idol topic locked so I’m not happy.

Read full topic

item.title: "Private Archives" - Community Input Needed
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

It’s really just documenting what we already have - but new stuff would be welcome obviously, erm I do need to know how to format chunks of code in a normal HTML document. Would you need to “make” that?

Or, since you a smart one, maybe be the 508 guru 'cos I have no idea on that…
Or write some documentation on frameworks?

What do you fancy?

Read full topic

item.title: "Private Archives" - Community Input Needed
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

I like the current design, it’s simple and easy to use. I’m sure heaps could be done to improve it however, my two cents would be adding something to the main page like “COMMON PROBLEMS AND IMPORTANT INFORMATION HERE,” which could link to a page listing things like compilers/errors, item lists etc. It will most likely still escape the people who we most want to click on it “javac not recognized help nao pl0x,” but I think it would still be useful.

Read full topic

item.description:
@error.login wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:44, topic:390164”]Well I’m kinda stuck in a way, because we all want nice sparkly websites, but the aim is to document as much information we’ve created over the years and archive it on the site. I thought the basic layout I already had would be enough?

What did you have in mind?[/quote]
Something nicer and easier to navigate through. I will have a go at doing a quick layout while I take a break from doing other stuff.

Read full topic
